1.content: We start, of course, in the TV room of an ordinary house, with a mother, a father, and...
1.title: A beginning

11.content: Is this baby a boy or a girl?
11.title: ...a baby.

111.content: What commercial have you ended up in?
111.title: Boy.

1111.content:
There was a mother named Frannie, a father named Jason, and a little baby named Robert.
While Jason was shopping, Frannie was watching TV with little Robert when a diaper ad came on.
Incidentally, how old is young Robert?
1111.title: A diaper commercial.

choices: ...on the changing table with a poopy diaper.
...in a high chair, spaghetti sauce on your face.
...playing with paints on the floor, legs and arms multi-colored.
1112.content:
A baby wipe has three uses:

Cleaning up dirty diapers

Wiping up a messy face after eating

And cleaning up more conventional messes on the hands, like sand or paint.

You find yourself...
1112.title: A baby wipe commercial.

11121.content:
(I'm confused. First it was, "once there was a baby", i.e. the baby is a separate character. Now, it's "you")

You/the baby boy was/were confused. One minute, you were/he was watching TV on your/his dad's knee, the next, you were/he was on a changing table in an unfamiliar house, and somewhere along the line, you/he had messed your/his diaper.

How old is this baby?
11121.title: ...on the changing table with a poopy diaper.

111213.content:
(Let's keep it third person, sorry.)

The baby was...
111213.title: In between.

1112131.content:
He was three months old and his name was Walt.
Just then, in walked a strange man.
He wasn't Walt's dad and Walt didn't recognize him.

"Admit it," said a voice from nowhere in particular, "You want what's best for your baby." Walt didn't recognize this voice, it was a woman, but not his mom. Walt squirmed; he didn't like being here with these strange people.

"Well," continued the voice as the man changed Walt's diaper, "Now you can. With the new Babyfresh wipes that kill 60% more germs than any other baby wipe and feel soft on your baby's skin. Babyfresh--the best for all babies."

Now that his diaper was changed, Walt...
1112131.title: 3 months old.

choices: A piece of furniture, like a crib or rocking chair.
11121313.content: What was this new commercial for?
11121313.title: Went into a different commercial.

1112132.content:
He was six months old, and his name was Alex.
Just then, a couple walked in but they weren't his parents.
The husband began to change Alex's diaper, but seemed to be having trouble wiping.
"Try the new Little Tots baby wipes!" said the wife, holding a packet of wipes that appeared to come out of nowhere.
She then began wiping Alex, explaining how these wipes were apparently far superior to the kind the husband had been using, and doing a much better job than the husband.
When they had finished, they picked Alex up and said in unison, "Little Tots! The best in baby care products!".

What happens now?
1112132.title: 6 months.

1112133.content:
The baby was nine months old and his name was Percy.
"Love 'n' Snuggles' baby care company has introduced a new extra-thick range of baby wipes," said a voice as someone came in to change Percy.
Who was it?
1112133.title: 9 months.

11122.content:
The young baby boy was confused.
How did he get onto the table and why was his face covered in spaghetti?
He soon got distracted by a voice and forgot about these questions.
After all, he was only...
11122.title: ...in a high chair, spaghetti sauce on your face.

choices: Cody giggles, but not by choice-it's a part of the script.
111221.content:
Cody frowned as some woman who was not his mommy pulled a wipe out of a container and cleaned up his face. However, there still were red stains where she wiped.

"Most budget wipes only absorb a certain amount of mess. New Cushies wipes get baby cleaner from head to toe."

The woman then wipes Cody with a Cushy, and gets him a lot cleaner.

"They're thicker, bigger, and come with lotion as well!" the voice adds.
111221.title: One year old.

1112211.content:
Cody giggled.
"What?" he thought, "I should not be laughing, this is not funny!".
He then...
1112211.title: Cody giggles, but not by choice-it's a part...

1112212.content:
The woman then picked Cody up.
"No!" said Cody, "Not Mommy!".
What happens now?
1112212.title: The woman picks Cody up.

choices: Was taken home by the woman who'd cleaned him.
11123.content:
The baby, whose name was James, looked up from the paints he was playing with.
"That's strange," he thought, "How did I get here?"
He kept playing with the paints, smearing different paints on his limbs.
"Do you keep finding your baby covered in paint like this?" said a man's voice.
It wasn't a voice that little James recognized.
Just then, a woman James didn't recognize walked into the room, carrying a packet of baby wipes.
As she cleaned him, the voice continued: "Well, worry no more! With Wetties baby wipes, it's soft on a baby's skin, yet it gets even the toughest stains off of the baby! Works on anything, from paint, to poop, to pasta sauce. And it kills 99.9% of germs. Order now at only $29.99 a pack!".

When the ad was over, James...
11123.title: ...playing with paints on the floor, legs and a...

111231.content: James found himself being warped through a red, green and blue void into another commercial...
111231.title: Went into another commercial.

1112311.content:
This time, the commercial was for a diaper.
James looked around. The red, green, and blue void was gone.
Now, he was...
1112311.title: ...for a diaper.

11123111.content: James looked down and began crying, because his diaper was...
11123111.title: In a car.

choices: A sale on baby clothes in general.

1112312.title: ...for clothing.

1112313.content: What sort of toy is James in an ad for?
1112313.title: ...for some sort of toy.

1112314.content: James found himself in an advert for...
1112314.title: ...for a piece of baby furniture.

choices: A special kind of tissue for sick babies.

choices: You cry inside a stroller, your diaper wet and leaky.

You wake up crying in a crib in the middle of the night, your diaper leaking.

112111.content:
Little Irene was crying.
Not only did she not recall being put in her stroller, her diaper was wet.
It was also leaking, so her right leg was having a drop of pee running down it.
How old is Irene?
112111.title: You cry inside a stroller, your diaper wet and ...

112112.content:
Mary was giggling.
She was in the living room with her father, running away from her father.
She had only recently learned to walk and was using it to her advantage.
Her father must have tried to change her diaper, as she was naked from the waist down and holding a clean diaper and a baby wipe.
"Come back here, Mary!"
Then, a voice came from above, advertising Huggies diapers.
Mary was confused. This was a lady's voice, but not her mommy's and nobody was in the room but her and Daddy!
As for Mary's dad...
112112.title: You giggle as you run away from daddy, holding ...

112113.content:
Tiffany woke up in her crib. Watching TV with Mom and Dad must have been a dream.
She looked up. It was still dark.
Then, she noticed that not only was she wet, her bed sheets were wet too. She began to cry.
How old is Tiffany?
112113.title: You wake up crying in a crib in the middle of t...

112114.content:
Denise had just had her first birthday, so she was only learning to walk.
Not knowing how she was now on the floor instead of the couch, and not caring that she had a saggy diaper, she stood up and attempted to walk, but after three steps, she fell over backwards.
Just then, someone came in to change her diaper, but who?

They can take the bigger backload and to prove this they drop marbles in their brand znd the opponents and the opponents brand tears first while theirs just keeps on holding marbles, "Perfects for stinkers loads" they said.

1221.content:
Once upon a time, there was a mother named Amy, a father named Stan, and a little toddler named Annette.
One day, Annette was watching TV with Amy, while Stan did the dishes, when she got sucked into a commercial.
There was a woman she didn't know changing her diaper, and a voice saying, "Premium Little Buddies diapers are designed to fit snugly without chafing, and they have tabs that even the squirmiest of toddlers cannot undo. Only $26.99 a pack."
Who do we follow now?
1221.title: A diaper.

choices: Training pants with a learning design.

Ivan woke up.
Hadn't he just been watching TV with his parents? Oh well, it must have been a dream.
He then realized that his bed wetting pants had leaked.
This made him cry. He could speak of course, he was three years old, but the surprise of having such a vivid dream and then waking up to a leaky diaper was making him cry.
Just then, in walked...
131121.title: You're in a crib in the middle of the night...

Harvey woke up in the morning.
"I must have been dreaming," he thought.
Just then, his mom walked in and lifted him out of bed.
It was at that moment that he realized that his night diaper was dry, and he giggled in joy; that was his first dry night.
Just then, a voice said, "Little Wrigglers bedwetting pants keep little ones asleep all night."
"Mommy, who's that?" asked Harvey.
His mom replied...

Just then,...

13121.content:
Derek scratched his head?
How did he end up in an ad for training pants?
"Huggies diapers come with a wetness liner so that the youngster feels wet before it drives the wetness away, enabling them to learn---" "What?!" thought Derek, "That's not Mommy, or Grandma, or Auntie Willa."
"Hello!" he shouted, but the voice went on, "--the difference between being wet and being dry so they will be potty trained faster. Huggies diapers. Only $30 a pack."
What happens now?
13121.title: A daytime training pant.

Little Alexander scratched his head.
One minute, he was watching TV and the next, he was...
13122.title: A nighttime training pant.

"The potty can be big and scary. Make it easier for your child with the new Super Potty."

Your mommy picks you up off the toilet and sits you down on a potty.

Hadn't Marlene stopped wearing diapers to bed a few nights ago?
She poked her diaper and it crinkled a bit.
Then, a voice-over said, "Squirmies diapers, for maximum protection by both day and night!".
What does Marlene do?

1322113.content: Does she have an accident in her Diaper?

choices: The Script makes her use her Diaper
13221131.content: Is it an Actual Accident, or is it because of the Rules of the Commercial?

1322121.content: You realized the diaper was wet! It felt:
1322121.title: Wet.

1322122.content:
The girl poked her padding, a cartoonish squishing noise inexplicably playing each time she did it. There was no doubt about it, the camera angles positioned themselves and were edited together suggestive of the idea that she'd had a bowel movement in her diaper. A lively flourish of instruments flared up as she, for some reason, began to smile.

"Boy, I sure am glad for Poopers™!" She giggled as she turned to run out of her room, an exaggerated zooming sound effect laid over it. Later, it was understandable to see that she'd been clothed and definitely in the middle of some sort of play time, but with quite a few visuals of the cameras positioned around her and her rear pretty much implying that nothing had changed downstairs since the beginning. More squishing sound effects seemed to come from her walking around, as well as other miscellaneous foley artistry making up whatever games she was playing with the other kids. The camera captured a few shots of her face, seeming a bit embarrassed, yet relieved at the same time as she ended up doing whatever the other kids were doing.

She had begun to understand that she was in some sort of scenario meant to specifically market a type of diaper for older children with some form of an issue when it comes to relieving their bowels in their undergarments. As effective as she admittedly felt the diaper was, the question still remained in her mind as to when the next change might be coming.

Was this commercial for a brand of Poopers meant to just get it's wearer by, or was it for some sort of "Heavy Duty" Poopers diapers, meant to go for long, looong periods of time?
1322122.title: Messy.

14131.content:
Being 6 years old, Ryan was always looking to take more and more steps to being a “big boy” as his parents called him. Not having accidents both in the day and night is just another way Ryan acts like a big boy. But as he woke up to his usual dry sheets and comfy pjs, he felt just a little off, at first he could not put his finger on what this feeling was, however as he woke up more he realized that there was a strange clammy feeling coming from his crotch are, he moved his little hand over the front of his pjs where he felt a bulge. This was weird for Ryan as he lifted his pants to see what looked like a pull-up complete with batman pictures all over the front.

Ryan was shocked as he had been doing very well with keeping his bed dry without the need for protection, in fact it had been a few months since he had any sort of night accident. But now he was laying in bed just feeling the wet pull up between his legs.

What does ryan do next?
14131.title: ...your sheets dry as a bone as the sun rises i...

14132.content: You sit up in bed in your soaked pajama pants and sob as your crotch area is cold and damp. A moment later your mom comes in your room flicking the light on, you see she has something in her hand and as she walks over to comfort you you can see its a...

The girl wakes up in the middle of the night, soaked. She wasn’t wearing a diaper at all, leading to the sheets and her pyjama’s getting all soaked. This was obviously part of the commercial where it showed what happened without the bedwetting aids.

What does the girl do now?
1422.title: Bedwetting aids.

info.brief_description: One kid gets sucked into a TV land, forced into commercials for products his or her age.
info.description:
A baby or toddler or preschooler accidentally hits some buttons on a remote and is sucked into a world of commercials, where they are the star!

Of course, given their age, they're most likely in one for Pull-Ups, or diapers, or pacifiers, or bottles.

Can they escape? Or will they be stuck forever in Commercial World?

Rules:

Keep it clean, family friendly.

Do your homework! A quick search on Youtube can help you create realistic commercials.
